posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I think I've overextended my reach here, though it may be that I've simply made some poor choices (yes, again).

I wondered if there was a viable way bring together those two great outdoorsmen, Ranger and Barbarian, and make use of their respective specialities - Bane of Enemies and Terrifying Rage. Turns out you can, but my results so far have been pretty ugly - the AC and saves make for particularly grim reading. It could be that going for a STR build rather than a DEX one was my first dumb idea. Maybe a DEX/CON tank would have been a better way forward. Or maybe I'm just looking for too much in a feat-starved build (no bonus feats at all - I'm not counting FEs, as they're kind of necessary for Bane to work). Oh, and SD is used rather than Rogue because I don't like xp penalties. And yes, I sacrificed Ranger spells, perhaps misguidedly.

Any advice would be welcome - including "Bin it, it'll never fly".

Anyway, this is where I currently am...

posts.content:
Hi Stag!
Great to see another build from you again!
I like the concept of these two underutilised classes being put together into a build
I like the usage of shadowdancer to help with crowd control management against opponents who do not have true sight, and to access tumble as a class skill for extra AC
The HP over 500 seems very high for a stealthy build, it certainly helps with survivability
The will save is a bit tricky. posts.content:
Such a terrifying build has to be ugly, so half-orc has to have style points here from an RP perspective, tall, muscular and ugly is how we like it...
In addition I realised getting Exotic Weapon Proficiency and taking either Two Bladed Sword or Double Axe might be nice here.

Sadly the feat is a little feat starved but I did find room for toughness so it could be done
If Stag's build has the ranger spell cats grace and a dex of 14 it should be able to hit the Dex Attribute Modifier of 8 when capped (26), allowing usage of padded armor (1+8) with maximum effectiveness combined with Barbarian's uncanny dodge to protect the Dex AC
The only thing I dont like about the half-orc verion is the lack of skill points so no trapsetting skills or taunt with such a large investment into stealth skills already
Human might be more optimal overall for the skill points, if one went human I wouldn't mind dropping some Cons for Wis though for the ranger spells and to pump the will save a little, 400hp+ would be more than enough I reckon for a HiPSer (perhaps the more experienced HiPSers out there might comment)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Interestingly enough, I'd had a look at a STR-based Half-Orc before posting the OP. The opening stats I worked from were STR 18 (30), DEX 14, CON 14, WIS 8, INT 13, CHA 6. The AB was the same as yours, Orion, but obviously no spells. The reason I pumped CON (as in the OP) was mostly for the duration of raging (CON modifier + 7 rounds + 2 more rounds in greater rage).

The biggest problems I had were 1. Skills - as you mention in your build, and 2. Even greater feat-starvation. You got around that by using Ranger bonus feats for EWF and EP, as well as losing Imp Crit. However, I wanted to use as many FEs as possible to maximise Bane and the FE bonuses. A bit swings and roundabouts, really.

It's kind of reassuring that folk can walk similar paths, though!
